content: gnome time to waste a witching hour knits design sometimes you want a quick feel-good project or you need to whip up a last-minute holiday gift sometimes it s just the dead of winter and you need a cute bonnet to keep you warm well hurry up and get knitting on this one there s gnome time to waste this bonnet is knit flat with german short row used to create shaping grafting stitch holds it all seamlessly together when finished materials - 1 skein malabrigo rasta or approx 90 yds of super bulky yarn - us 15 needles 24 circular recommended - stitch markers if desired for marking short row gauge 2 sts per inch on us 15 needle or size needed for gauge pattern abbreviations and techniques - k knit - p purl - st s stitch es - st st stockinette stitch - gwt german wrap and turn - ds double stitch made by gwt - m1r make one right leaning stitch - m1l make one left leaning stitch - grafting stitch - cable cast on instructions cast on 46 sts knit two row on next row begin working in st st starting with a knit row work in st st for 16 row 18 total row have been worked short row shaping row 1 k43 sts gwt row 2 p39 sts gwt row 3 k34 sts gwt row 4 p29 sts gwt row 5 k24 sts gwt row 6 p19 sts gwt on the next row knit across knitting each ds as one stitch as you come to them purl the next row purling all remaining ds as one stitch as you come to them point shaping row 1 k22 m1r k2 m1l k22 48 sts row 2 purl row 3 k21 m1r k6 m1l k21 50 sts row 4 purl leaving a long enough tail for seaming cut yarn holding both needle tips together with right side facing out use grafting stitch to seam the back of the hat together your seam will end at the point of the hat neck edge and ties using cable cast-on method cast on 15 sts with right sides facing you pick up approximately 33 sts along the neck edge the exact count isn t as important as making sure the neck edge doesn t pucker at other end cable cast-on another 15 sts approximately 63 sts row 1 knit row 2 purl bind off all sts knitwise weave in all ends and gently block if desired then wear enjoy and be cozy pattern questions can be directed to witchinghourknits@gmail com this pattern is for personal use and not to be re-distributed © dora violet
